category.name: Bands_and_Artists/D/Delirious
category.summary: Christian Rock band from Littlehampton, UK. Formed in 1992, the band has had a number of UK chart hits, including Deeper, See The Star, and It's OK.

item.title: America
item.description:
Released on mp3.com in response to the events of September 11th, 2001.

Track originally released on Audio Lessonover?
item.availabilitynotes: Formerly available for download from mp3.com, but no longer available online.

item.title: Deeper
item.description: This is the original version of Deeper that appeared on the album King of Fools in 1997. It was also released on the Deeper single in May, 1997.

item.title: I Could Sing of Your Love Forever
item.description: This is the version of this track that was released as a single in December, 2002.

item.title: Majesty [Here I am]
item.description:
Taken from the album "World Service".

Also available is:

  • Musical Score
  • Front Cover
  • Back Cover
  • Body Artwork

item.title: Rain Down
item.description:
Taken from the album "World Service".

  • Musical Score
  • Front Cover
  • Back Cover

  • Wallpaper: 800x600 1024x768 1600x1200
item.availabilitynotes: Formerly available for download from mp3.com, but no longer available online.

item.title: Take me Away
item.availabilitynotes:
Formerly available for download from mp3.com, but no longer available online.

This track was released exclusively online as a single, then later on two albums, Audio Lessonover? and Touch.

item.title: White Ribbon Day
item.description:
Released in response to the events of September 11th, 2001, after requests from fans of the band.

This song, "White Ribbon Day" was the band's first single release, the song was also on the album King of Fools.

Archive:d
item.description: Includes all the material from "A View from the Terraces" and "Pro:mode", along with five live video projections (Fire, Alien, Rollercoaster, Obsession, Investigate) and previously unreleased videos to Waiting For The Summer, I Could Sing of Your Love Forever and Take Me Away.

item.title: Pro-mod:e
item.label: Furious? Records
item.description: Approximately 45 minutes long, containing all the band's pop videos to date, along with the track 'Everything' from Glo, and backstage footage.
